intro: Solenanthus ovatifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf solenanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its ovate, narrow leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in coastal and sandy soils, often found in dry, sunny environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
